update.description:
# Video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JAMdLo0CadU

Note this is a slightly earlier version.

# Summary

* Open a dialog during joint creation

* Options to modify the joint type, axes, pose and pose of parent / child links

* Make it possible to use manipulation tools during joint creation

![mate.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2502845949-mate.png)

# Issues

* fix issue #1512

# CI

[100% function coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20coverage%20jobs/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/519/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui_model/JointCreationDialog_cc.html) for new class
update.title: New joint creation for the Model Editor

content.raw:
I found that when closing the main window with the joint creation dialog open, it caused a segfault which prevented the main window destructor to finish executing completely. 

fixed in e4ad35e

I found that when closing the main window with the joint creation dialog open, it caused a segfault which prevented the main window destructor to finish executing completely.

fixed in e4ad35e

pullrequest.title: New joint creation for the Model Editor

content.raw:
~~Would it be better to make the joint maker the parent?~~ The JointMaker is not a widget, so it can't be the parent.

Is it a problem to be standalone? Is this related to it remaining open once we close the main window? I think this should be fixed if the dialog is deleted in the destructor.
content.html:
Would it be better to make the joint maker the parent? The JointMaker is not a widget, so it can't be the parent.

Is it a problem to be standalone? Is this related to it remaining open once we close the main window? I think this should be fixed if the dialog is deleted in the destructor.

pullrequest.title: New joint creation for the Model Editor

content.raw:
One problem I noticed when using this for the tutorial is that an offset is added to the position of the joint line after saving.

to reproduce:

1.  add two links

1. create joint with default values

1. File -> Save

The orange joint line moves to a different pose
content.html:
One problem I noticed when using this for the tutorial is that an offset is added to the position of the joint line after saving.

to reproduce:

  1. add two links

  2. create joint with default values

  3. File -> Save

The orange joint line moves to a different pose
